PT Sentence Text: Bracing to resist lateral loads shall be designed and constructed in accordance with part 4., or good engineering practice such as that provided in CWC 2014 Engineering Guide for Wood Frame Construction
The unobstructed openable ventilation area to the outdoors for rooms and spaces in residential buildings ventilated by natural means shall conform to Table 9.32.2.2.

For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 8.3.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
Columns for garages and carports shall conform to part 9., except that 89 mm by 89 mm wood columns may be used.
In an access to exit the required width of a ramp with a slope more than 1 in 8 shall be based on not less than 9.2 mm per person.
Except for head joints left open for weep holes and ventilation, solid masonry units shall be laid with full head and bed joints.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Ground Cover in Unheated Crawl Spaces
PT Sentence Text: Joints in sheet-type ground cover required in Sentence 9.18.6.1. shall be lapped not less than 100 mm and weighted down.
Masonry or concrete chimneys shall conform to part 9.

Except as provided in Sentences 9.33.6.2. to 9.33.6.2. and in Article 3.6.4.3., all ducts, duct connectors, associated fittings and plenums used in air duct systems shall be constructed of steel, aluminum alloy, copper, clay or similar noncombustible material.
A whirlpool shall have a minimum clear deck space not less than 1.8 m at the main entrance point.

Not less than one swimming pool ladder with grab rails shall be located adjacent to the platform of an above-ground swimming pool and one ladder shall be provided at the opposite side or end of the swimming pool.
The portion of any log coming into contact with masonry or concrete at or below ground level, or with soil, shall be treated with preservative.

Except as provided in Sentence 4.1.4.1.(5), in areas of a building where partitions, other than permanent partitions, are shown on the drawings, or where partitions might be added in the future, allowance shall be made for the weight of such partitions.
Measures shall be taken to limit movement of smoke from a fire in a floor area below the lowest exit storey into upper storeys. (See Note A-3.2.6.2.(4).)

The accumulation factor, Ca, shall be 1.0, which corresponds to the uniform snow load case, except that where appropriate for the shape of the roof, it shall be assigned other values that account for increased non-uniform snow loads due to snow drifting onto a roof that is at a level lower than other parts of the same building or at a level lower than another building within 5 m of it horizontally, as prescribed in Articles 4.1.6.5., Article 4.1.6.6. and 4.1.6.8., increased non-uniform snow loads on areas adjacent to roof projections, such as penthouses, large chimneys and equipment, as prescribed in Articles 4.1.6.7. and 4.1.6.8., non-uniform snow loads on gable, arch or curved roofs and domes, as prescribed in Articles 4.1.6.9. and 4.1.6.10., increased snow or ice loads due to snow sliding as prescribed in Article 4.1.6.11., increased snow loads in roof valleys, as prescribed in Article 4.1.6.12., and increased snow or ice loads due to meltwater draining from adjacent building elements and roof projections.

Unless the joist size is designed to support such loads, loadbearing interior walls at right angles to floor joists shall be located not more than 900 mm from the joist support where the wall does not support a floor, and not more than 600 mm from the joist support where the wall supports one or more floors.

Wall studs that support only a load from an attic not accessible by a stairway are permitted to be placed on the flat within the limits permitted in Article 9.23.10.1. provided the studs are clad on not less than one side with plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing fastened to the face of the studs with a structural adhesive, and the portion of the roof supported by the studs does not exceed 2.1 m in width.
The top plates in loadbearing walls shall be lapped or otherwise tied at corners and intersecting walls in accordance with Sentence 9.23.11.4.(4).

ARTICLE_TITLE: Air Leakage Control in Underground Roofs
PT Sentence Text: Waterproofing systems for roofs of underground structures shall be sealed to the air barrier in the walls.
Plywood applied in panels shall have all edges supported.

The length of fasteners for gypsum board shall conform to Table 9.29.5.5., except that lesser depths of penetration are permitted for assemblies required to have a fire-resistance rating provided it can be shown, on the basis of fire tests, that such depths are adequate for the required rating.
Woven or welded wire mesh shall be galvanized.
Materials shall be thoroughly mixed before and after water is added.

Except as provided in Article 6.2.1.5., vented products of combustion, other than those referred to in Sentence 6.3.3.1.(1), shall be discharged away from the building, so as not to re-enter it, to a distance not less than 2.15 m above sidewalks and driveways, 3 m from outdoor air intakes, 3 m horizontally or vertically from doors and operable windows, and 3 m horizontally or vertically from occupiable outdoor spaces, excluding maintenance spaces.

Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.11.(3), a major occupancy classified as a residential occupancy shall be separated from other major occupancies classified as mercantile or medium-hazard industrial occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
Words that appear in italics in this Part are defined in Article 1.4.1.2..

The fire-resistance rating of the fire separation required by Sentence 3.3.4.3. is permitted to be less than 1 h but not less than 45 min provided the fire-resistance rating required by part 3. is permitted to be less than 1 h for the floor assembly above the floor area, or the floor assembly below the floor area, if there is no floor assembly above.
This Section applies to excavations and foundation systems for buildings.
Notwithstanding the requirements of this Subsection, plumbing fixtures are not required for a building of low human occupancy. (See Note A-3.7.2.1.(4).)

All exterior wall and roof cavities shall be completely filled with insulation having a resistance to heat flow not less than that provided by glass fibre batts but the resistance need not be more than RSI 2.1.
Where rooms or spaces are intended for the storage, manufacture or use of hazardous or explosive material, such rooms or spaces shall conform to part 3.. (See Note A-3.3.1.2.(1).)
Except as described in Sentence 9.10.13.10.(2), every door in a fire separation shall have a self-closing device.

For the design of buildings that may be subject to wake buffeting or channelling effects from nearby buildings, or that are very dynamically sensitive, as defined in Sentence 4.1.7.2.(3), the Wind Tunnel Procedure described in Article 4.1.7.12., shall be used to determine the specified wind loads.

Where the sills of windows and doors installed in exterior walls are not self-flashing, flashing shall be installed between the underside of the window or door and the wall construction below. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(5).)

Every residential occupancy shall incorporate provisions for non-heating-season ventilation in accordance with part 9., and except as required by Sentences 9.32.1.2. and 9.32.1.2.(3), if supplied with electrical power and a heating system, provisions for heating-season ventilation in accordance with part 6..

Where a habitable room or space is not provided with natural ventilation as described in Article 9.32.2.2. and is not mechanically cooled, the non-heating-season mechanical ventilation system shall have the capacity to exhaust indoor air from the room or space or to introduce outdoor air to that room or space at a rate of one air change per hour.
Where a chimneyflue serves only one appliance, the flue area shall be at least equal to that of the flue pipe connected to it.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
PT Sentence Text: Unsprinklered concealed spaces of combustible construction created by a ceiling, roof space or unoccupied attic space shall be separated by fire blocks into compartments not more than 60 m in greatest dimension, and where such space contains exposed construction materials having a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25, not more than 300 m2 in area.

Handrails installed along aisle centre lines as required by Table 3.3.2.10. shall comply with Sentences 3.4.6.5. to 3.4.6.5. and 3.4.6.5.(14), have gaps not less than 560 mm and not more than 915 mm wide, measured horizontally, at intervals not exceeding five rows, comply with Sentence 3.4.6.5. at terminations and required gaps, and have an intermediate rail located 305 mm below the principal handrail.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
PT Sentence Text: The requirements regarding fire-resistance rating, type of construction and type of cladding need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.
Sentence 3.3.1.18. does not apply to the front edges of stages, to loading docks, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.
Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.2.2. and 9.8.2.2. and Article 9.8.4.7. , the clear height over stairs shall not be less than 2 050 mm.

Except where they serve storage garages, guards in industrial occupancies are permitted to consist of a top railing, and one or more intermediate rails spaced such that openings through the guard are of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is 535 mm.
A slide escape shall not be erected on any building as a required exit, but is permitted to be provided as an additional egress facility if unusual hazards are foreseen.

Except as required in Sentence 3.3.2.1.(3), provisions 12.2.3.2, 12.2.3.3, 12.2.5.4, 12.2.5.5, 12.2.5.6, 12.2.11.1, 12.4.1 and 12.4.2 of Chapter 12 of NFPA 101-2018 Life Safety Code are permitted to be used in lieu of Articles 3.3.2.4. , 3.3.2.5., 3.3.2.9., 3.3.2.11. and 3.3.2.12. (See Note A-3.3.2.1.(2).)
If an assistive listening system referred to in Article 3.8.2.9. is an induction loop system, only half the seating area in the room need be encompassed.
Except for masonry veneer where each masonry unit is supported individually by the structural backing, masonry veneer shall consist of solid masonry units not less than 75 mm thick.
Drains shall conform to part 9.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing
PT Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 9.10.14.5. to 9.10.14.5.(8), cladding on exposing building faces and exterior walls located above exposing building faces that enclose an attic or roof space, for buildings or fire compartments where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is more than 10% of the exposing building face, need not be noncombustible where the wall assembly complies with the requirements of Sentence 3.1.5.5. when tested in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S134-13 Fire Test of Exterior Wall Assemblies

Except as provided in Sentence 5.2.2.2.(5), the wind uplift resistance of membrane roofing assemblies shall be determined in accordance with the requirements of CSA CAN/CSA-A123.21-10 Dynamic Wind Uplift Resistance of Membrane-Roofing Systems (See Note A-5.2.2.2.(4).)
When ceramic tile is applied to a mortar base the cementitious material shall consist of one part Portland cement to not more than one-quarter part lime by volume.

When nails are used, wood strip flooring shall be toe nailed or face nailed with not less than one nail per strip at the spacings shown in Table 9.30.3.3., except that face nailed strips more than 25 mm in width shall have at least 2 nails per strip.
A self-contained heating-season ventilation system serving a single dwelling unit shall comply with part 9. (See Note A-9.32.1.2.(2).)
An electrical equipment vault shall conform to Sentences 3.6.2.7.(2)to 3.6.2.7. if it is required by the Electrical Code Regulation made pursuant to the Safety Codes Act.

This Subsection applies to laboratories where dangerous goods, including flammable liquids and combustible liquids, are used in normal laboratory operations in quantities or in a manner that creates a fire or explosion hazard.

Combustible window sashes and frames are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided each window in an exterior wall face is an individual unit separated by noncombustible wall construction from every other opening in the wall, windows in exterior walls in contiguous storeys are separated by not less than 1 m of noncombustible construction, and the aggregate area of openings in an exterior wall face of a fire compartment is not more than 40% of the area of the wall face.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group D, up to 6 Storeys, Sprinklered
PT Sentence Text: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.58. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction, used singly or in combination, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, except as provided in Sentence 3.2.2.58.(3), where the roof assembly has a height greater than 25 m measured from the floor of the first storey to the highest point of the roof assembly, the roof assembly shall be constructed of noncombustible construction or fire-retardant-treated wood conforming to Article 3.1.4.5., mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

Except as provided in Article 9.8.4.7., required exit stairs and public stairs serving buildings of other than residential occupancy shall have a width of not less than the greater of 900 mm, or 8 mm per person based on the occupant load limits specified in Table 3.1.17.1.
Helicopter landing areas on roofs shall be provided with telephone extensions or means to notify the fire department.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
PT Sentence Text: The principal ventilation fan control required by Sentence 9.32.3.3. shall be wired in such a way that activation of the principal ventilation fan automatically activates the outdoor air supply fan required by Sentence 9.32.3.5.(2), and the outdoor air supply fan does not operate when the principal ventilation fan is not operating.
The fire-resistance rating required by Sentence 3.3.2.6. is permitted to be waived if the floor area in which the corridor is located is sprinklered throughout.

This Subsection applies to design and fire protection requirements for buildings or parts thereof used for the storage, handling, use and processing of dangerous goods, including flammable liquids and combustible liquids, in quantities in excess of those identified in Table 3.2.7.1. of Division B of the NFC(AE). (See Note A-3.3.6.1.(1).)
The length of travel to an exit door by any aisle shall be not more than 45 m.

If a pair of doors is installed in a corridor that provides access to exit in both directions, the doors shall swing in opposite directions, with the door on the right hand side swinging in the direction of travel to the exit.

If, during construction, the soil, rock or groundwater is found not to be of the type or in the condition used in design and as indicated on the drawings, the design shall be reassessed by the designer.
Where an unheated crawl space is ventilated by natural means, ventilation shall be provided to the outside air by not less than 0.1 m2 of unobstructed vent area for every 50 m2 of floor area.

Except as provided in Sentences 4.1.6.7. and 4.1.6.7.(3), the accumulation factor, Ca, for areas adjacent to roof-mounted vertical projections shall be calculated in accordance with Sentence 4.1.6.5. using the following values for the peak accumulation factor, Ca0, and the drift length, xd: Ca0 shall be taken as the lesser of 0.67ghCbSsandgl07.5CbSs+1,and xd shall be taken as the lesser of 3.35h and (2/3)l0, whereh= height of the projection, and l0= longest horizontal dimension of the projection.
Skylights shall be considered to have no shading.

The energy model calculations shall account for the heat-recovery efficiency of heat-recovery ventilators using a minimum of 2 data test points derived from testing in accordance with Sentence 9.36.3.9.(3)or 9.36.3.9.(3), as applicable.

A perimeter overflow channel shall be designed to prevent matter entering it from being washed back into the swimming pool, and dimensioned to minimize the risk of a bather’s arms or feet becoming caught in it.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Fire Blocks in Horizontal Concealed Spaces
PT Sentence Text: A concealed space in an exterior cornice, a mansard-style roof, a balcony or a canopy in which exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating more than 25, shall be separated by construction conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. at locations where the concealed space extends across the ends of required vertical fire separations, and so that the maximum dimension in the concealed space is not more than 20 m.

Heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems, including mechanical refrigeration equipment, shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in, but not limited to, the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the HRAI Digest, the Hydronics Institute Manuals, the NFPA Standards, the SMACNA Manuals, ACGIH 28th Edition Industrial Ventilation: A Manual of Recommended Practice for Design published by the ACGIH, CSA B214-16 Installation Code for Hydronic Heating Systems CSA CAN/CSA-Z317.2-10 Special Requirements for Heating, Ventilation, and Air-Conditioning Systems in Health Care Facilities and EPA 625/R-92/016 Radon Prevention in the Design and Construction of Schools and Other Large Buildings

The criteria for testing and the conditions of acceptance for a wall assembly to satisfy the requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.8. are that the fire exposed area of the wall assembly shall be not less than 9.3 m2 and have no dimension less than 2.75 m, the exposed surface shall include typical vertical and horizontal joints, the test shall be continued for not less than 15 min and the standard time/temperature curve of the referenced standard shall be followed, the noncombustible protective material must remain in place and no through openings should develop that are visible when viewed normal to the face of the material, and the noncombustible protective material should not disintegrate in a manner that would permit fire to propagate along the surface of the test assembly.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Types of Glass and Protection of Glass
PT Sentence Text: Glass other than laminated or tempered safety glass shall not be used for a shower or bathtub enclosure.

Vehicle guardrails shall be designed for a concentrated load of 22 kN applied horizontally outward at any point 500 mm above the floor surface so as to produce the most critical effect. (See Note A-4.1.5.14..)
A recessed lighting fixture shall not be located in an insulated ceiling unless the fixture is designed for this type of installation.
Shakes shall be spaced 6 mm to 9 mm apart and the joints in any one course shall be separated not less than 40 mm from joints in adjacent courses.
Factory-finished hardboard cladding shall conform to CGSB CAN/CGSB-11.5-M87 Hardboard, Precoated, Factory Finished, for Exterior Cladding
Nails used for roofing shall be corrosion-resistant roofing or shingle nails conforming to ASTM F 1667-13 Driven Fasteners: Nails, Spikes, and Staples or CSA B111-1974 Wire Nails, Spikes and Staples

ARTICLE_TITLE: Security for Banks and Mercantile Floor Areas
PT Sentence Text: Exit and egress facilities required for evacuation of persons other than the public from a floor area or a part of a floor area referred to in Sentence 3.4.6.17. shall have an aggregate width based on the maximum number of persons other than the public and determined in accordance with Articles 3.4.3.1.to 3.4.3.3.
Treads and risers shall not differ significantly in run and rise in successive flights in any stair system.
Concrete slabs shall not be less than 75 mm thick exclusive of concrete topping.
A service room containing space heating, space cooling and service water heating appliances is permitted to contain other service equipment such as electrical service equipment.

Except as amended by Sentence 3.7.3.1.(2), a non-flammable medical gas piping system shall be installed in conformance with CSA Z7396.1-12 Medical Gas Pipeline Systems – Part 1: Pipelines for Medical Gases, Medical Vacuum, Medical Support Gases, and Anaesthetic Gas Scavenging Systems

Except as required by Sentence 3.6.4.3.(1), combustible ducts, including plenums and duct connectors, are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided these ducts and duct connectors are used only in horizontal runs.
The clear height in a storage garage shall be not less than 2 m.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group C, up to 6 Storeys, Sprinklered
PT Sentence Text: Buildings referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.50. are permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction, used singly or in combination, and except as provided in Sentence 3.2.2.50.(3), floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, except as provided in Sentence 3.2.2.50.(4), where the roof assembly has a height greater than 25 m measured from the floor of the first storey to the highest point of the roof assembly, the roof assembly shall be constructed of noncombustible construction or fire-retardant-treated wood conforming to Article 3.1.4.5., mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.56. shall be of noncombustible construction, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, roof assemblies shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, except that in a building not more than 1 storey in building height this requirement is waived, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Elements of Structures, Non-structural Components and Equipment
PT Sentence Text: Forces shall be applied in the horizontal direction that results in the most critical loading for design, except for Category 6 of Table 4.1.8.18., where the forces shall be applied up and down vertically.

For the design of roofs, the value of Cp shall be established as follows, where x is the distance from the upwind edge of the roof: for H/D 1.0, Cp = –1.0, and for H/D < 1.0,Cp= –1.0 for x H, and = –0.5 for x > H.
A smoke alarm required by Sentence 3.2.4.20. shall be installed in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S553-14 Installation of Smoke Alarms

Each fire compartment referred to in Sentence 3.3.3.5. shall be capable of accommodating, in addition to its own occupants, the occupants of the largest adjacent fire compartment based on a clear floor space of 2.5 m2 per patient in the adjacent fire compartment.

Except as permitted by Sentence 3.4.3.2.(3), the minimum aggregate required width of exits serving floor areas intended for assembly occupancies, residential occupancies, business and personal services occupancies, mercantile occupancies, and industrial occupancies shall be determined by multiplying the occupant load of the area served by 6.1 mm per person for ramps with a slope of not more than 1 in 8, doorways, corridors and passageways, 8 mm per person for a stair consisting of steps whose rise is not more than 180 mm and whose run is not less than 280 mm, or 9.2 mm per person for ramps with a slope of more than 1 in 8, or stairs, other than stairs conforming to Sentence 3.4.3.2.(1).

Except as provided in Sentence 9.10.9.17.(5), where a building containing a repair garage also contains a dwelling unit, an air barrier system conforming to part 9. shall be installed between the dwelling unit and the suite containing the garage to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes. (See Note A-9.10.9.16.(4).)
A lighting outlet with fixture shall be provided in storage rooms.

The provision of makeup air as described in Sentence 9.32.3.8. is not required in a dwelling unit with solid-fuel-burning appliances, where all other fuel-fired appliances are direct-vented or mechanically vented.

Except as required by Sentence 3.2.1.1.(5), the space above a mezzanine need not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height, provided the aggregate area of mezzanines that are not superimposed does not exceed 40% of the open area of the room in which they are located (see Note A-3.2.1.1.(3)(a)), and except as permitted in Sentences 3.2.1.1. and 3.3.2.13.(3), the space above the mezzanine is used as an open area without partitions or subdividing walls higher than 1 070 mm above the mezzanine floor.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Travel Limit to Exits or Egress Doors
PT Sentence Text: The travel limit from a floor level in a dwelling unit to an exit or egress door may exceed 1 storey where that floor level has direct access to a balcony.

Where a dwelling unit is located above another dwelling unit or common space in a house with a secondary suite, the upper dwelling unit shall be provided with a second and separate means of egress where an egress door from that dwelling unit opens onto an exterior passageway that has a floor assembly with a fire-resistance rating less than 45 min, is served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and is located more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.
The specified wind loads for a building and its components shall be determined using the Static, Dynamic or Wind Tunnel Procedure as stated in Sentences 4.1.7.1. to 4.1.7.1.(5).

ARTICLE_TITLE: Intermediate Support for Rafters and Joists
PT Sentence Text: Collar ties referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.7. more than 2.4 m long shall be laterally supported near their centres by not less than 19 mm by 89 mm continuous members at right angles to the collar ties.
Sheathing membrane required in Sentence 9.27.3.3. shall be applied so that joints are lapped not less than 100 mm.
When a stone dash finish is used, the stone shall be partially embedded in the second coat before the second coat starts to set or stiffen.
Resilient flooring used on concrete slabs supported on ground shall consist of asphalt, rubber, unbacked vinyl or vinyl with an inorganic type backing.
The distance from the back of the fire chamber to the plane of the fireplace opening shall be not less than 300 mm.
An exit opening into an interconnected floor space shall conform to Sentence 3.4.3.2.(6).

A draft stop shall be provided at each floor level within an interconnected floor space, immediately adjacent to and surrounding the opening, and shall be not less than 500 mm deep measured from ceiling level down to the underside of the draft stop.

Where an exit enclosure connects with a floor area through an enclosed vestibule or corridor separated from the floor area by fire separations having not less than a 45 minfire-resistance rating, the glazed areas described in Sentence 9.9.4.3. need not be limited as required in Sentence 9.9.4.3.(2).
A smoke alarm shall be installed on or near the ceiling.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group A, Division 1, One Storey, Limited Area, Sprinklered
PT Sentence Text: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.21. is permitted to be of heavy timber construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 45 min, or of heavy timber construction, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly, or be of heavy timber construction.

Except for joists, rafters, trusses and beams, visually graded lumber shall conform to the grades in Table 9.3.2.1. (See Article 9.23.4.2. for joists, rafters and beams and Article 9.23.14.11. for trusses.)

ARTICLE_TITLE: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
PT Sentence Text: Doors, frames and hardware that conform to a security level of at least Grade 10 as described in the Annex to ASTM F 476-14 Security of Swinging Door Assemblies are not required to conform to Sentences 9.7.5.2.(3)to 9.7.5.2.(7). (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(2).)
Exit facilities complying with this Section shall be provided from every floor area that is intended for occupancy. (See Note A-3.4.1.1.(1).)

ARTICLE_TITLE: Ground Cover in Unheated Crawl Spaces
PT Sentence Text: Where a crawl space is unheated, a ground cover shall be provided consisting of not less than 50 mm of asphalt, 100 mm of 15 MPa Portland cement concrete, Type S roll roofing, or 0.10 mm polyethylene.

Where the building is provided with a fire alarm system, a hold-open device permitted by Sentence 3.1.8.14. shall release upon a signal from a smoke detector connected to the fire alarm system and located as described in ULC CAN/ULC-S524-14 Installation of Fire Alarm Systemswhere the hold-open device is used on an exit door, a door opening into a public corridor, an egress door referred to in Sentence 3.4.2.4.(2), a closure serving an assembly, care, treatment, detention, or residential occupancy, a door in a fire separation referred to in Sentence 3.3.1.7. or Sentence 3.3.3.5.(4), or a door required to function as part of a smoke control system.

The proposed and reference houses shall both be modeled using the same approach and assumptions, except where building components or energy efficiency features are permitted by this Subsection to be different.

Granular material need not be installed under slabs in garages, carports or accessory buildings, or buildings of industrial occupancy where the nature of the process contained therein permits or requires the use of large openings in the building envelope even during the winter.

Table 9.10.8.1. does not apply to a dwelling unit that has no other dwelling unit above or below it, houses with a secondary suite, where the floor framing is protected on the underside by a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board, or a dwelling unit that is not above or below another major occupancy.
The minimum depth of foundations for exterior concrete steps with more than 2 risers shall conform to Sentences 9.12.2.2.(1), 9.12.2.2. and 9.12.2.2.(5).
Other fenestration assemblies and their components shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Article 5.1.4.1. (See Note A-5.9.3.2.(1).)
Air contaminants in spaces where workers will be present shall not exceed the occupational exposure limits set out in the Occupational Health and Safety Act and its Regulations.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Thermal Characteristics of Windows, Doors and Skylights
PT Sentence Text: Windows and doors described in Sentence 9.7.3.3. do not require a thermal break where they are installed as vehicular access doors, storm windows and doors, or windows and doors that are required to have a fire-resistance rating.
Openable windows used for the venting required by Sentence 3.2.6.6. shall be permanently marked so that they are easily identifiable.
Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.9.8.(6), non-loadbearing interior walls at right angles to the floor joists are not restricted as to location.
Where sloping surfaces of shingled roofs intersect to form a valley, the valley shall be flashed.
Where a fire-resistance rating is determined based on Table 9.10.3.1.-A, Sentence 9.29.5.9. need not apply for the purpose of fire protection.

Except as permitted in Sentence 9.29.6.2.(2), where plywood for interior finish is grooved, the grooves shall not extend through the face ply and into the plies below the face ply unless the groove is supported by framing or furring.
Nails shall be spaced not more than 100 mm o.c. along edge supports and 200 mm o.c. along intermediate supports.

Aspects of mechanical ventilation systems not specifically described in this Subsection shall be designed, constructed and installed in accordance with good practice such as that described in the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the HRAI Digest, the HRAI Residential Mechanical Ventilation Manual, the Hydronics Institute Manuals and the SMACNA manuals.

Where the 1-in-50 hourly wind pressure is equal to or greater than 0.8 kPa, roof rafters, joists or trusses shall be tied to the wall framing with connectors that will resist a factored uplift load of 3 kN.

The unobstructed path of travel for the firefighter required by Sentence 3.2.5.5. from the vehicle to the building shall be measured from the vehicle to the fire department connection provided for the building, except that if no fire department connection is provided, the path of travel shall be measured to the principal entrance of the building.

Where alterations are made to an existing building, universal washrooms complying with part 3. are permitted to be provided in lieu of facilities for persons with physical disabilities in washrooms used by the general public. (See Note A-3.8.2.8.(1).)
This Subsection applies to care, treatment and detention occupancies. (See Note A-3.3.3.1.(1).)
Cementitious materials and aggregates for mortar and grout shall comply with CSA A179-14 Mortar and Grout for Unit Masonry

ARTICLE_TITLE: Ventilation Systems Used in Conjunction with Forced Air Heating
PT Sentence Text: An outdoor air supply duct shall be installed between the outdoors and the furnace return air plenum and shall be connected not less than 3 m upstream of the plenum connection to the furnace, as measured along the length of the duct, or through an acceptable mixing device installed in the return air plenum.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling HVAC System of Reference House
PT Sentence Text: The part-load performance of HVAC equipment in the reference house shall be calculated using modeled part-load performance characteristics, where applicable, or the performance values for each type of system multiplied by an adjustment factor from Table 9.36.5.15.-A, 9.36.5.15.-B or 9.36.5.15.-C as follows: for furnaces, by multiplying the furnace steady-state efficiency by the adjustment factor given in Table 9.36.5.15.-A, for heat pumps and air conditioners, by multiplying the heat pump steady-state coefficient of performance by the adjustment factor given in Table 9.36.5.15.-B, and for boilers, combination space-heating and service water heating systems, and integrated mechanical systems, by multiplying the net-full-load heating efficiency by the adjustment factor given in Table 9.36.5.15.-C.

For shapes not addressed in Sentence 4.1.6.2.(8), Ca corresponding to the non-uniform snow load case shall be established based on applicable field observations, special analyses including local climatic effects, appropriate model tests, or a combination of these methods.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Design Basis for Plain and Reinforced Masonry
PT Sentence Text: Buildings and their structural members made of plain and reinforced masonry shall conform to CSA S304-14 Design of Masonry Structures
The top surface of uncompleted masonry exposed to the weather shall be completely covered with a waterproofing material when construction is not in progress.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Calculation of Ceiling, Wall, Fenestration and Door Areas
PT Sentence Text: The gross ceiling or roof area shall be calculated as the sum of the interior surface areas of insulated ceiling and/or roof assemblies and of skylight openings.
The material used on the floors, walls and ceilings of a personal service facility shall provide surfaces that can be easily cleaned.

Except for exhaust fans in kitchens, washrooms and bathrooms in dwelling units, and except for fans used for smoke venting as required by Article 3.2.6.6., air moving fans in a system that serves more than 2 storeys shall be designed and installed so that in the event of a fire these fans can be stopped by means of a manually operated switch at the central alarm and control facility.
Wood girders and beams in heavy timber construction shall be closely fitted to columns, and adjoining ends shall be connected by ties or caps to transfer horizontal loads across the joints.

Except as provided in Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.7.(4), Article 3.2.2.8. and Sentence 3.2.2.18.(2), in a building in which one major occupancy is located entirely above another major occupancy, the requirements in this Subsection for each portion of the building containing a major occupancy shall apply to that portion as if the entire building were of that major occupancy.
Except when supported on ribbon boards, floor joists shall have not less than 38 mm length of end bearing.
Except as provided in Sentences 9.26.3.1. and 9.26.3.1.(3), the slopes on which roof coverings may be applied shall conform to Table 9.26.3.1.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Anchoring of Roof Framing to the Top of Flat Insulating Concrete
PT Sentence Text: The anchor bolts described in Sentence 9.20.17.6. shall be placed in the centre of the flat insulating concrete form wall and shall be embedded no less than 100 mm into the concrete.
Lumber shall conform to part 9.
Except as provided in Sentence 6.3.2.10.(2), exhaust ducts of non-mechanical ventilating systems serving separate rooms or spaces shall not be combined.
A barrier-free entrance required by Sentence 3.8.2.2.(1)or 3.8.2.2. shall be designed in accordance with part 3.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Evaporative Cooling Towers, Evaporative Fluid Coolers and Evaporative
PT Sentence Text: Make-up water connections shall be equipped with backflow prevention devices that conform to Article 2.6.2.1. of Division B of the NPC.
Exits from outdoor stadia or grandstands shall be located not more than 25 m apart.
Combustible sprinkler piping is permitted to be used within a sprinklered floor area in a building required to be of noncombustible construction. (See also Article 3.2.5.13.)

Minimum thicknesses for sheet metal material that are stated in this Part refer to the actual minimum base metal thicknesses measured at any point of the material and, in the case of galvanized steel described in Sentence 9.3.3.2.(1), include the thickness of the galvanizing coating unless otherwise indicated.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Uniformity of Runs in Flights with Mixed Treads within Dwelling
PT Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.8.4.5. and Article 9.8.4.6., where a flight of stairs consists of both tapered treads and rectangular treads, all the treads shall have a uniform run when measured at a point 300 mm from the centre line of the inside handrail.
Smoke detectors required by Sentence 3.2.4.14. shall be designed as part of the building fire alarm system.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling Building Envelope of Proposed House
PT Sentence Text: Building envelope assemblies and components separating conditioned space from enclosed unconditioned space shall have a solar heat gain coefficient equal to 0.

The spacing of supports required in Sentence 9.20.10.1. shall be not more than 20 times the wall thickness for all loadbearing walls and exterior non-loadbearing walls, and 36 times the wall thickness for interior non-loadbearing walls.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Fire-Resistance Ratings for Walls, Columns and Arches
PT Sentence Text: Light-frame walls, columns, arches and beams as well as loadbearing steel elements that support floors between dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be protected by not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board. (See Note A-9.10.8.3.(2).)

The design and installation of heating systems, including requirements for combustion air, and air-conditioning systems other than those described in Sentence 9.33.1.1. shall conform to part 6.. (See Note A-9.33.1.1. and part 9.)
Daycare facilities shall have at least one sink suitable for the washing of toys that is not located in a washroom.
Skirting shall be installed if the wall of a module is less than 15 m from the wall of another module or from another wall of the same module that forms an included angle of less than 135°.
Where hold-open devices are used on doors in required fire separations, they shall be installed in accordance with Article 3.1.8.14.

For buildings in the Low and Normal Importance Categories as set out in Table 4.1.2.1., the wind exposure factor, Cw, given in Sentence 4.1.6.2. may be reduced to 0.75 for rural areas only, or to 0.5 for exposed areas north of the treeline, where the building is exposed on all sides to wind over open terrain as defined in Sentence 4.1.7.3.(5), and is expected to remain so during its life, the area of roof under consideration is exposed to the wind on all sides with no significant obstructions on the roof, such as parapet walls, within a distance of at least 10 times the difference between the height of the obstruction and CbCwSs/ metres, where is the specific weight of snow on roofs as specified in Article 4.1.6.13., and the loading does not involve the accumulation of snow due to drifting from adjacent surfaces.
Blocking for the attachment of cladding shall be not less than 38 mm by 38 mm lumber securely nailed to the framing and spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
Runners shall be provided at the tops and bottoms of walls.

Air barrier systems shall possess the characteristics necessary to provide an effective barrier to air infiltration and exfiltration under differential air pressure due to stack effect, mechanical systems or wind.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group B, Division 2, up to 3 Storeys, Sprinklered
PT Sentence Text: A building classified as Group B, Division 2 is permitted to conform to Sentence 3.2.2.39. provided except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building is sprinklered throughout, it is not more than 3 storeys in building height, and it has a building area that is not limited if the building is not more than 1 storey in building height, not more than 12 000 m2 if 2 storeys in building height, or not more than 8 000 m2 if 3 storeys in building height.
Except as required by Sentence 9.35.4.1.(2), interior finish need not be applied to garage and carport walls.
In exterior walls composed of more than one wythe, each wythe shall be not less than 90 mm thick.

Urinals described in Sentence 3.8.2.8. shall be wall-mounted, with the rim located not more than 430 mm above the floor, be adjacent to an accessible route, have a clear width of approach of 800 mm centred on the urinal and unobstructed by privacy screens, have no step in front of it, have a flush control that is automatic, or complies with Sentence 3.8.3.8. and is located 900 mm to 1 100 mm above the floor, and have a vertically mounted grab bar installed on each side that complies with Article 3.7.2.8., is not less than 600 mm long, with its centre line 1 000 mm above the floor, and is located not more than 380 mm from the centre line of the urinal.

The foundation depths required in Sentence 9.12.2.2. are permitted to be decreased where experience with local soil conditions shows that lesser depths are satisfactory, or where the foundation is designed for lesser depths by a registered professional.

Materials installed to provide required dampproofing shall be capable of protecting assemblies against moisture transfer from the ground, compatible with adjoining materials, and resistant to mechanisms of deterioration that may reasonably be expected, given the nature, function and exposure of the materials.
The requirements of Sentence 9.36.3.9. shall be met using a principal ventilation rate not less than that required in part 9. (See Note A-9.36.3.9.(3).)

The structural design of air-supported structures shall conform to CSA S367-12 Air-, Cable-, and Frame-Supported Membrane Structures using the loads stipulated in part 4., in accordance with limit states design in part 4.

Coatings applied to materials other than gypsum board to provide required resistance to vapour diffusion shall conform to the requirements of Sentence 5.5.1.2. when tested in accordance with ASTM E 96/E 96M-13 Water Vapor Transmission of Materials by the desiccant method (dry cup).

Metal ties of the individual rod type shall extend from within 25 mm of the outer face of the wall to within 25 mm of the inner face of the wall, be completely embedded in mortar except for the portion exposed in cavity walls, and be staggered from course to course.
Where an exhaust duct passes through an unheated space or is not separated from an unheated space by an insulated building assembly, the duct shall be insulated to not less than RSI 0.5.

The design of deck-level diving boards and the corresponding water depths and clearances for a public swimming pool shall be in accordance with ANSI/APSP/ICC ANSI/APSP/ICC-1 2014 Public Swimming Pools
If wall inlets are used, they shall be submerged not less than 0.6 m, and located as close to the bottom as possible where the water depth is less than 0.6 m.

Prefinished wall panelling not less than 4.2 mm thick applied over plywood panelling, waferboard or oriented strandboard not less than 7.5 mm thick shall be considered to provide a 5 min membrane protection.

A building classified as Group F, Division 3 is permitted to be of heavy timber construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination provided it is not more than 1 storey in building height, and it has a building area not more than 5 600 m2 if facing one street, 7 000 m2 if facing 2 streets, or 8 400 m2 if facing 3 streets.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Egress from Roof Area, Podiums, Terraces, Platforms and Contained
PT Sentence Text: An access to exit shall be provided from every roof intended for occupancy and from every podium, terrace, platform or contained open space.

The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 22 m2 , with no dimension greater than 6 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are sprinklered.

In addition to the distribution mentioned in Sentence 4.1.6.3.(1), flat roofs and shed roofs, gable roofs of 15° slope or less, and arch or curved roofs shall be designed for the specified uniform snow load indicated in Sentence 4.1.6.2.(1), which shall be calculated using the accumulation factor Ca = 1.0, distributed on any one portion of the loaded area and half of this load on the remainder of the loaded area, in such a way as to produce the most critical effects on the member concerned. (See Note A-4.1.6.3.(2).)

A voice communication system conforming to Article 3.2.4.22. shall be provided in a building if the floor of the top storey is more than 36 m above grade, or a floor area or part of a floor area located above the third storey is designed or intended for use as a Group B, Division 2 or 3 occupancy.
Shingle tabs shall be secured with cold application cement applied at the rate of not less than 0.5 L/m2 of cemented area, or hot application asphalt applied at the rate of 1 kg/m2 of cemented area.
In hot process applications each layer of bitumen-saturated felt shall be laid while the bitumen is hot, with each layer overlapping the previous one.
Water repellent loose-fill insulation is permitted to be used between the outer and inner wythes of masonry cavity walls. (See Note A-9.25.2.4.(5).)
Openings for natural ventilation other than windows shall provide protection from the weather and insects.
A cleanout opening with a metal frame and a tight-fitting metal door shall be installed near the base of the chimney flue.
Wood screws specified in this Section shall conform to ASME B18.6.1-1981 Wood Screws (Inch (See Note A-9.23.3.1.(3).)

Except as permitted in Sentence 3.4.6.18.(2), doors providing access to floor areas from exit stairs shall not have locking devices to prevent entry into any floor area from which the travel distance up or down to an unlocked door is more than 2 storeys.

The fire-resistance rating of field-applied and factory-built grease duct enclosure assemblies shall be determined in conformance with ULC CAN/ULC-S144-12 Fire Resistance Test – Grease Duct Assemblies

Dehumidifying cooling coil assemblies and condensate-producing heat exchangers shall be equipped with drain pans beneath them that are designed in accordance with Section 5.11, Drain Pans, of ASHRAE ANSI/ASHRAE 62.1-2007 Ventilation for Acceptable Indoor Air Quality provided with an outlet that is piped to the outside of the airstream in a location where condensate can be eliminated, and installed so that water drains freely from the pan.

Every exit shall have a wall or a well-secured guard on each side, where there is a difference in elevation of more than 600 mm between the walking surface and the adjacent surface, or the adjacent surface within 1.2 m of the walking surface has a slope of more than 1 in 2.

In a stairway, a window for which the distance measured vertically between the bottom of the window and a line drawn through the outside edges of the stair nosings is less than 900 mm, or a window that extends to less than 1 070 mm above the landing, shall be protected by a guard that is located approximately 900 mm above a line drawn through the outside edges of the stair nosings, or not less than 1 070 mm high measured to the top of the guard from the surface of the landing, or be fixed in position and designed to resist the lateral design loads specified for guards and walls in Articles 4.1.5.14.and 4.1.5.16.

Two points of egress shall be provided for a service space referred to in Sentence 3.2.1.1. if the area is more than 200 m2 , or the travel distance measured from any point in the service space to a point of egress is more than 25 m.

The clear height over stairs shall be measured vertically, over the clear width of the stair, from a straight line tangent to the tread and landing nosings to the lowest point above. (See Note A-3.4.3.4.)

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group A, Division 1, Any Height, Any Area, Sprinklered
PT Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.20. shall be of noncombustible construction, and except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building shall be sprinklered throughout, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.
Where fuel-fired appliances are installed on a roof, such appliances shall be installed in conformance with Article 3.6.1.5.

A hold-open device used on a door located between a corridor used by the public and an adjacent sleeping room in a treatment occupancy need not release automatically as stated in Sentence 3.1.8.14.(2).

Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the requirements in CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights and CSA A440S1-17 Canadian Supplement to AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11, NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights

If lead sheet is used as a flashing for a plumbing system pipe, it shall be worked over and into a hub of the increaser, which shall then be fitted with a 100 mm diam or larger roof ring caulked into the hub of the increaser.
The protection required by Sentences 9.10.12.5. and 9.10.12.5. shall be provided by cladding that conforms to part 9., part 9., or one of the methods described in Sentence 3.2.3.7. or 3.2.3.7.(4).

Except as provided in Sentences 9.9.6.2. and 9.9.6.2.(3), the clear opening height of doorways shall be not less than 2 030 mm high at exit doors, doors that open into or are located within a public corridor, and doors that open into or are located within another facility that provides access to exit from a suite.

Except as provided in Sentence 9.9.7.3. and except for dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite, where an egress door from a dwelling unit opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway it shall be possible from the location where the egress door opens onto the corridor or exterior passageway to go in opposite directions to 2 separate exits unless the dwelling unit has a second and separate means of egress.
Interlaid strips referred to in Sentence 9.26.10.2. shall be lapped not less than 150 mm at hips and ridges in a manner that will prevent water from reaching the roof sheathing.
The cant strip required in Sentence 9.26.11.10. need not be provided where a gravel stop is installed at the edge of roofs.

Where an exterior exit passageway provides the only means of egress from the rooms or suites it serves, the wall and ceiling finishes of that passageway, including the soffit beneath and the guard on the passageway, shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25, except that up to 10% of the total wall area and 10% of the total ceiling area is permitted to have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 150.

If a door is equipped with a latching mechanism, a device that will release the latch and allow the door to swing wide open when a force of not more than 90 N is applied to the device in the direction of travel to the exit shall be installed on every exit door from a floor area containing an assembly occupancy having an occupant load more than 100, every door leading to an exit lobby from an exit stair shaft, and every exterior door leading from an exit stair shaft in a building having an occupant load more than 100, and every exit door from a floor area containing a high-hazard industrial occupancy.

Where access to floor areas through unlocked doors is required by Sentence 3.4.6.18. , it shall be possible for a person entering the floor area to have access through unlocked doors within the floor area to at least one other exit.
A service room containing an incinerator shall not contain other fuel-fired appliances.

Except where fire dampers, window assemblies and glass block are used as closures, closures of the same fire-protection rating installed on opposite sides of the same opening are deemed to have a fire-protection rating equal to the sum of the fire-protection ratings of the closures. (See Note A-3.1.8.1.(2).)

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group A, Division 3, One Storey, Increased Area
PT Sentence Text: If intended for occasional use for trade shows and similar exhibition purposes, a building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.32. that is more than 1 500 m2 in building area shall be sprinklered throughout.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling HVAC System of Proposed House
PT Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.36.5.11.(12), where a forced-air system is installed in the proposed house, the energy model calculations shall assume the circulation fan operates when the heating, cooling or principal ventilation system is operating. (See Note A-9.36.5.11.(11).)

A 2-stage fire alarm system is permitted to be zone coded so that, upon the operation of any manual station, waterflow detecting device, or fire detector, a coded alert signal is sounded indicating the zone of alarm initiation, the coded alert signal is repeated in its entirety not less than 4 times, and a continuous alert signal is sounded upon completion of the coded signals referred to in Sentence 3.2.4.4. and Sentence 3.2.4.4.(4).

A single stage fire alarm system installed in a building of assembly occupancy that has an occupant load more than 300 shall be designed to notify the fire department, in conformance with Sentence 3.2.4.7.(4), that an alarm signal has been initiated.
Service pipes passing through a storage bin for solid fuel shall be protected or so located as to avoid damage to the pipes.

The heat source component of combined space- and service water heating systems that are not within the scope of CSA CAN/CSA-P.9-11 Performance of Combined Space and Water Heating Systems shall meet the performance requirements stated in Table 9.36.3.10. for the applicable equipment type. (See Note A-9.36.3.10.(3).)

Where a portion of a roof supports an occupancy, that portion shall be constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to the rating for "Floors Except Floors over Crawl Spaces" in Table 9.10.8.1.

Compliance with the required ASTC ratings shall be demonstrated through measurements or calculations carried out in accordance with Sentence 5.8.1.2.(2), or the construction of separating assemblies conforming to those presented in Table 9.10.3.1.-Aor 9.10.3.1.-B, as applicable, that have an STC rating of not less than 50 in conjunction with flanking assemblies constructed in accordance with Article 9.11.1.4.
For words not defined by Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), reference should be made to the Oxford University Press June 2004 Canadian Oxford Dictionary, 2nd Edition

Every exit door from a building containing sleeping, dining or recreational facilities shall be equipped with plunger-type hardware or hardware listed and labeled by a testing agency, that will release and allow the door to swing open if a force not exceeding 90 N is applied to the hardware in the direction of exit travel.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Fence and Gate Design and Construction
PT Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 7.2.2.1. and except for wading pools, the entire area of an outdoor swimming pool shall be protected by a fence, building wall or enclosure that can prevent access by unauthorized persons, and its height above the outside ground level shall be not less than 1.8 m for a private swimming pool, and 2.0 m for all other swimming pools.

All structural framing elements not considered to be part of the SFRS must be investigated and shown to behave elastically or to have sufficient non-linear capacity to support their gravity loads while undergoing earthquake-induced deformations calculated from the deflections determined in Article 4.1.8.13.
The design, construction, installation and alteration of every indoor incinerator shall conform to NFPA 82-2014 Incinerators and Waste and Linen Handling Systems and Equipment
Subflooring shall be provided beneath finish flooring where the finish flooring does not have adequate strength to support the specified live loads (see part 9.).
Coal-tar products and asphalt products shall not be used together in built-up roof construction.
Hardboard applied in horizontal lapped strips shall have not less than a 5 mm gap provided at the butted ends, which shall be sealed or otherwise protected with suitable mouldings.
Steel studs and runners shall conform to AISI S201-12 North American Standard for Cold-Formed Steel Framing - Product Data
A gap of not less than 2 mm shall be left between sheets of plywood, OSB or waferboard.
If the flooring is end matched, it shall be laid so that no 2 adjoining strips break joints in the same space between supports and each strip bears on no fewer than 2 supports.
Ceramic tile shall be set in a mortar bed or applied to a sound smooth base with a suitable adhesive.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Crawl Spaces and Attic or Roof Spaces
PT Sentence Text: Unconditioned and unoccupied crawl spaces and unconditioned and unoccupied attic or roof spaces shall be ventilated by natural or mechanical means as required by Part 5. (See Note A-6.3.1.2.(1).)

Mechanical ventilation systems provided in accordance with Sentence 6.3.1.4. shall be designed such that the pressure in the storage garage is less than the pressure in adjoining buildings of other occupancy, or in adjacent portions of the same building having a different occupancy.

Where wood is required by this Article to be treated to resist termites or decay, such treatment shall be in accordance with Table 2, Use Categories for Specific Products, Uses, and Exposures, of CSA CAN/CSA-O80.1-08 Specification of Treated Wood as follows: Use Category 1 (UC1), where the wood member is used in interior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member remains dry, Use Category 2 (UC2), where the wood member is used in interior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member may be subjected to occasional sources of moisture, Use Category 3.2 (UC3.2), where the wood member is used in exterior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member is uncoated or is used in a configuration conducive to moisture accumulation, Use Category 4.1 (UC4.1), where the wood member is in contact with the ground, the wood member is in contact with fresh water, or the vertical clearance between the wood element and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm and the wood elements are not separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier, or Use Category 4.2 (UC4.2), where the wood member is used in critical structural components, including permanent wood foundations.
Where the dependent area is a bedroom, direct passage shall be provided between the two areas.

The minimum specified load applied vertically at the top of every required guard shall be 1.5 kN/m and need not be considered to act simultaneously with the horizontal load provided for in Sentence 4.1.5.14.(1).

The owner of a building for which Sentences 3.2.4.7. to 3.2.4.7. require signals to the fire department shall provide evidence of compliance to the authority having jurisdiction by means of a Fire Protective Signalling Certificate from a certified listing agency showing the address of the building, the listed fire alarm installation company, and the listed fire alarm monitoring company.
Every doorway into rooms within the dwelling unit shall have a clear width not less than 850 mm when the door is in the open position.
Not less than one hose bibcock conforming to the requirements of Article 7.2.3.17. shall be provided in each dressing room.

An above-ground swimming pool is permitted to be installed and operated as a public swimming pool or semi-public swimming pool adjacent to or near existing dressing rooms if the existing dressing rooms are in satisfactory condition and the layout and number of showers meet the requirements of this Code, and an impervious walkway, not less than 1.2 m wide, is provided between the swimming pool and dressing rooms.
The identification plate shall be fixed to the module in a location that is visible when the unit is complexed or standing alone.

For a deck-level wading pool, the required surge capacity is permitted to be less than the volume stated in Sentence 7.2.3.27. provided the proposed surge capacity is acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Crane-Supporting Structures and Impact of Machinery and Equipment
PT Sentence Text: The minimum specified load due to equipment, machinery or other objects that may produce impact shall be the sum of the weight of the equipment or machinery and its maximum lifting capacity, multiplied by an appropriate factor listed in Table 4.1.5.11.

Each stairway that serves storeys above the lowest exit level shall have a vent to the outdoors, at or near the bottom of the stair shaft, that has an openable area of 0.05 m2 for every door between the stair shaft and a floor area, but not less than 1.8 m2, opens directly to the outdoors or into a vestibule that has a similar opening to the outdoors, and has a door or closure that is openable manually, and can remain in the open position during a fire emergency.

Flashing need not be installed as described in Sentence 9.27.3.8. where the upper cladding elements overlap the lower cladding elements by not less than 25 mm, where the cladding above and below the joint is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space (see Sentence 9.27.2.2.(1)), and the horizontal detail is constructed so as to minimize the ingress of precipitation into the air space, or at horizontal construction joints in stucco, where the joint is finished with an expansion-contraction strip, and the cladding is installed outboard of a drained and vented air space (see Sentence 9.27.2.2.(1)).

Sealant shall be provided at vertical joints between different cladding materials unless the joint is suitably lapped or flashed to prevent the entry of rain. (See Articles 9.7.6.2. , 9.20.13.12.and 9.28.1.5.)

ARTICLE_TITLE: Continuity of the Air Barrier System
PT Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.25.3.6.(3), where the air barrier system consists of flexible sheet material, all joints shall be sealed, or lapped not less than 100 mm and clamped, such as between framing members, furring or blocking, and rigid panels.
The second coat shall be not less than 6 mm thick.
Waterless urinals are permitted to be used in buildings provided with a water supply.

The values of storey shears, storey forces, member forces, and deflections used in the design of all structural framing elements and components of the isolation system shall be obtained from analysis conforming to Sentence 4.1.8.19. using one of the following values, whichever produces the most critical effect: mean plus IE times the standard deviation of results of all Non-linear Dynamic Analyses, or IE times the mean of the results of all Non-linear Dynamic Analyses.

Except within the floor area of a storage garage, the minimum headroom clearance in every access to exit shall conform to the requirements of Article 3.4.3.4. for exits. (See also Sentence 3.3.5.4.(5).)

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group A, Division 3, Any Height, Any Area, Sprinklered
PT Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Article 3.2.2.16., the building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.29. shall be of noncombustible construction, and except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.7. and 3.2.2.18.(2), the building shall be sprinklered throughout, floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 2 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

In an access to exit from a floor area used or intended to be used for patients in a Group B, Division 2 occupancy or residents in a Group B, Division 3 occupancy, the required width of corridors, doorways, and ramps shall be based on not less than 18.4 mm per person.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Ventilation Systems Not Used in Conjunction with Forced Air
PT Sentence Text: Except where a heat recovery ventilator is used to supply the outdoor air, the outdoor air shall be tempered to at least 12°C before being circulated to habitable spaces.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Indoor Storage of Anhydrous Ammonia and Flammable,
PT Sentence Text: Where required by the NFC(AE), cylinders of dangerous goods classified as flammable gases stored indoors shall be located in a room that is separated from the remainder of the building by a gas-tight fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of at least 2 h, that is located on an exterior wall of the building, that can be entered from the exterior, and whose closures leading to the interior of the building are equipped with self-closing devices that keep the closures closed when not in use, and constructed so as to prevent the migration of gases from the room into other parts of the building.
Exits shall be located and arranged so that they are clearly visible or their locations are clearly indicated and they are accessible at all times.

Any wall, partition or floor assembly required to be a fire separation shall except as permitted by Sentence 3.1.8.1.(2), be constructed as a continuous element, and as required in this Part, have a fire-resistance rating as specified (see Note A-3.1.8.1.(1)(b)).

Where the concrete in a flat insulating concrete form wall acts as the air barrier, the continuity of the plane of airtightness shall be maintained between the concrete and adjacent air barrier materials.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Thermal Characteristics of Building Assemblies Below-Grade
PT Sentence Text: Where only a portion of a floor-on-ground has embedded heating ducts, cables or pipes, that heated portion shall be insulated to the effective thermal resistance required in Table 9.36.2.8.-A or 9.36.2.8.-B under its full bottom surface to 1.2 m beyond its perimeter including exterior edges if applicable.
Service water heating systems that use solar thermal technology shall conform to the manufacturer’s design requirements and installation procedures.
The portion of a deep foundation unit permanently in contact with soil or rock shall be structurally designed as a laterally supported compression member.

Coverings, linings and associated adhesives and insulation of air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall be of noncombustible material when exposed to heated air or radiation from heat sources that would result in the exposed surface exceeding a temperature of 120°C.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Flume and Receiving Pool Design and Construction
PT Sentence Text: A receiving pool shall have a deck area on not less than three sides.
Ramps shall comply with the requirements of Article 3.8.3.5.

For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in Sentence 1.2.1.1.(1), the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in Table 7.5.1.1. (See Note A-1.1.2.1.(1).)
A material, assembly, or structural member is permitted to be assigned a flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification on the basis of .
The principal-load factor 1.5 for live loads L in Table 4.1.3.2.-A and LXC in Table 4.1.3.2.-B may be reduced to 1.25 for liquids in tanks.
Wood columns in heavy timber construction shall be continuous or superimposed throughout all storeys.
The requirements of Sentence 3.2.3.8. are waived for wall assemblies that comply with the requirements of Article 3.1.5.5. (See Note A-3.1.4.1.(1).)

Materials, design, construction and installation of windows, doors and skylights that separate conditioned space from unconditioned space or the exterior but that are not covered in the scope of CSA AAMA/WDMA/CSA 101/I.S.2/A440-11 NAFS – North American Fenestration Standard/Specification for Windows, Doors, and Skylights shall conform to the remainder of this Subsection or part 9., and the applicable requirements in part 9., or to part 5..
Backer rod shall conform to ASTM C 1330-02 Cylindrical Sealant Backing for Use with Cold Liquid-Applied Sealants (See Note A-9.27.4.2.(1).)
Application of plaster wall and ceiling finishes, including installation of metal or gypsum lath, shall conform to CSA A82.30-M1980 Interior Furring, Lathing and Gypsum Plastering
Stucco lath shall be applied with the long dimension horizontal.
Every dwelling unit shall be supplied with potable water.
A fire separation is not required between a fireplace and the space it serves.

Fans for heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be located and installed so that their operation does not adversely affect the draft required for proper operation of fuel-fired appliances, and does not allow the air in the duct system to be contaminated by air or gases from the boiler room or furnace room.
Buildings erected on permafrost shall have foundations designed by a designer competent in this field in accordance with the appropriate requirements of part 4..

Structural wood elements shall be pressure-treated with a preservative to resist decay, where the vertical clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm (see also Articles 9.23.2.2. and 9.23.2.3.), or where the wood elements are not protected from exposure to precipitation, the configuration is conducive to moisture accumulation, and the moisture index is greater than 1.00.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Group C, up to 4 Storeys, Sprinklered
PT Sentence Text: The building referred to in Sentence 3.2.2.51. is permitted to be of combustible construction or noncombustible construction used singly or in combination, and except as permitted by Sentences 3.2.2.51. and 3.2.2.51.(4), floor assemblies shall be fire separations with a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, mezzanines shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and loadbearing walls, columns and arches shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the supported assembly.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Resistance to Forced Entry for Doors
PT Sentence Text: Except for storm or screen doors, doors described in Sentence 9.7.5.2. that swing outward shall be provided with hinges or pins so that the doors cannot be removed when they are in the closed position. (See Note A-9.7.5.2.(8).)

ARTICLE_TITLE: Equivalent Static Force Procedure for Structures Satisfying
PT Sentence Text: The static loading due to earthquake motion shall be determined according to the procedures given in this Article.
The requirement for handrails in Sentence 3.8.3.5. need not apply to a ramp serving as an aisle for fixed seating.
All isolator units shall be designed for the forces described in Sentence 4.1.8.20.(3), and able to accommodate the TDD determined at the specific location of each isolator unit.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling Building Envelope of Reference House
PT Sentence Text: Windows and other glazed components in the reference house shall have a maximum overall thermal transmittance as required in Table 9.36.2.7.-A for the applicable heating degree-day category.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Modeling HVAC System of Reference House
PT Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.36.3.8.(1), the reference house shall be modeled without a heat-recovery ventilator.

Masonry units shall comply with ASTM C 73-10 Calcium Silicate Brick (Sand-Lime ASTM C 126-13 Ceramic Glazed Structural Clay Facing Tile, Facing Brick, and Solid Masonry Units ASTM C 212-14 Structural Clay Facing Tile CSA CAN/CSA-A82-14 Fired Masonry Brick Made from Clay or Shale CSA A165.1-14 Concrete Block Masonry Units CSA A165.2-14 Concrete Brick Masonry Units or CSA A165.3-14 Prefaced Concrete Masonry Units
Ducts that penetrate the building envelope shall be constructed airtight by sealing the penetration through the building envelope. (See Note A-9.36.2.10.(14).)

The building shall be located, the building site shall be graded, or water shall be directed away from building assemblies so as to prevent or accommodate the accumulation of surface water against the building or adjacent buildings.
Where the airtight material used in the air barrier system is installed toward the exterior of the building envelope, its location and properties shall conform to part 9. (See Note A-9.36.2.9.(6).)
A water-operated gas chlorinator shall provide an automatic shutoff of gas when water pressure fails and shall vent leakage to the outside atmosphere.
Openings in a firewall shall conform to the size limits described in Article 3.1.8.6. and the aggregate width of openings shall be not more than 25% of the entire length of the firewall.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Fire Blocks between Vertical and Horizontal Spaces
PT Sentence Text: Fire blocks conforming to Article 3.1.11.7. shall be provided at all interconnections between concealed vertical and horizontal spaces in interior coved ceilings, drop ceilings and soffits in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating more than 25, and at the end of each run and at each floor level in concealed spaces between stair stringers in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a flame-spread rating more than 25.

In proportioning structural members to limit serviceability problems resulting from deflections, consideration shall be given to the intended use of the building or member, limiting damage to non-structural members made of materials whose physical properties are known at the time of design, limiting damage to the structure itself, and creep, shrinkage, temperature changes and pre-stress.

Words and phrases used in Division B that are not included in the list of definitions in Article 1.4.1.2. shall have the meanings defined in the Safety Codes Act and its Regulations or the NFC(AE), or the meanings that are commonly assigned to them in the context in which they are used, taking into account the specialized use of terms by the various trades and professions to which the terminology applies.
Subflooring described in Sentence 9.23.15.2. shall conform to grade D-2 or D-3 in ANSI A208.1-2009 Particleboard
Not less than a 3 mm clearance shall be provided between OSB and waferboard cladding and door or window frames.
Except as provided in Sentence 9.26.7.4.(2), shingles shall be fastened with at least 4 nails or staples for 1 m wide shingles so that no nails or staples are exposed.
When applied directly to framing or over furring strips, plywood cladding thickness shall conform to Table 9.27.8.2.

ARTICLE_TITLE: Intersection of Built-Up Roofs and Walls other than Masonry
PT Sentence Text: Flashing plies shall extend not less than 150 mm up the wall referred to in Sentence 9.26.4.7. behind the sheathing paper.
The clearance between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing shall be not less than 50 mm for interior chimneys, and 12 mm for exterior chimneys.

Columns need not be provided with lateral support as described in Sentence 9.17.2.2.(2), where the distance from finished ground to the underside of the joists is not more than 600 mm, and the columns support a deck with no superstructure.

If a building is sprinklered throughout, an electrical equipment vault referred to in Sentence 3.6.2.7. need not be sprinklered provided the vault is designed for no purpose other than to contain the electrical equipment, and the vault contains a smoke detector which will actuate the building fire alarm system in the event of a fire in the vault.

Exhaust systems are permitted to exhaust into a storage garage, provided they serve rooms that are accessible only from that storage garage, the exhaust contains no contaminants that would adversely affect the air quality in the storage garage (see Note A-6.3.2.10.(6)(b)), and they are designed in accordance with Sentence 6.3.2.7.(3).

Except as permitted by this Section and by Sentence 3.4.2.1.(2), at the point where a doorway referred to in Sentence 3.3.1.3. opens onto a public corridor or exterior passageway, it shall be possible to go in opposite directions to each of 2 separate exits.
The clear height over landings serving a single dwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be not less than 1 950 mm.
Except as provided in Sentences 9.8.6.3. to 9.8.6.3.(7), landings shall be at least as wide and as long as the width of the stair or ramp in which they occur.
